Foreign Diplomats Lay Floral Basket before President Kim Il Sung's Statue
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Lay Floral Basket before President Kim Il Sung's Statue 
    Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- The economic and commercial councilors' corps here laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill Wednesday on the occasion of the 56th birthday of the DPRK.
 After laying the floral basket the members of the corps made a bow in humble reverence for the President who devoted his all life to the foundation of the DPRK and its development and the accomplishment of the cause of global peace and independence and made immortal contributions to the development of friendly relations among nations.    
 Written on the ribbon of the floral basket were letters "His Excellency the Great Leader President Kim Il Sung Is Immortal."

Dancing Party Given in Celebration of DPRK Anniversary
articles.content:
Dancing Party Given in Celebration of DPRK Anniversary 
    Pyongyang, September 9 (KCNA) -- A dancing party of young vanguard of the Ministry of People's Security took place on Wednesday to celebrate the 56th birthday of the DPRK.
 The participants danced dances in humble reverence for President Kim Il Sung, who successfully accomplished the cause of building the state after the liberation of the country and built a socialist powerful state, independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in national defence.    
 They merrily danced to the tunes of such songs as "Let's Sing of Our Pride in Being under the Guidance of the General", "Pyongyang Is Best" and "Let's Support Our Supreme Commander with Arms", renewing their determination to remain true to the Songun idea and leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and discharge the honorable mission and duty as political guardians of the Workers' Party of Korea.

Greetings to Tajik President
articles.content:
Greetings to Tajik President
    Pyongyang, September (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Emomali Rakhmonov, president of Tajikistan, on its national day.
 The message wished the president greater success in his work for the country's prosperity and expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples.
